receptorAffinity.distinctionNote: Higher affinity for 5-HT1A than 5-HT2A, unlike typical psychedelics

classification.comparisonToClassical: Different mechanism and subjective profile than classical psychedelics

demographics.primaryUsers: Caucasian males with history of other substance use

usePatterns.frequency: Infrequent - most report once a year or less
usePatterns.therapeuticUse: Improving PTSD, depression, anxiety, addiction symptoms

globalData.reason: Not typically included in epidemiological surveys
globalData.grouping: Often grouped with other tryptamines and synthetic cathinones

needForCare.association: Strongest association with perceived need for care among psychedelics

legalStatus.international: Schedule I (USA) and controlled in many countries

coreExperiences.description: Complete loss of sense of self

coreExperiences.comparability: Comparable to psilocybin in some contexts

coreExperiences.description: Experience of void or complete absence
coreExperiences.uniqueness: More common with 5-MeO-DMT than other psychedelics

coreExperiences.description: Feeling of being dead or dying

comparisonToOtherPsychedelics.visualCharacter: Less visual than DMT, more void-like
comparisonToOtherPsychedelics.mysticalQualities: Can induce mystical experiences comparable to psilocybin

researchLimitations.note: Less data available than other psychedelics
researchLimitations.uncertainty: Difficult to define safe dosage ranges

intranasal.note: Subjective effects and intensity increase with dose

doseResponseCurve.implication: Small dose increases can cause large effect increases

uncertaintyFactors: Variable user knowledge of dose consumed

withoutMAOI.reason: Rapid breakdown by MAO enzymes in gut/liver

individualVariability.implications: Variable drug exposure and susceptibility to adverse effects

uncertainties: Unclear if bufotenine from metabolism produces notable effects
Individual differences may influence bufotenine buildup
Potential for unexpected effects from metabolite accumulation

investigationalUses.evidence: May reduce symptoms for at least one week

riskFactors.name: High Potency and Steep Dose-Response
riskFactors.description: 5-MeO-DMT is highly potent with steep dose-response curve
implications: Small increases in dose cause large increases in effects
Users often uncertain about dose consumed
harmReduction: Obtain from trusted sources with known potency

riskFactors.name: Extreme Intensity of Experience
riskFactors.description: Experiences often described as more intense than other psychedelics
riskFactors.preparation: Extra preparation crucial for managing intensity

riskFactors.name: Loss of Control and Unpredictable Behavior
riskFactors.description: Users may exhibit unexpected behaviors and lack awareness
riskFactors.awareness: Users often lack awareness or memory of behaviors during acute effects
riskFactors.physicalDanger: May pose physical danger due to involuntary movements

riskFactors.name: Flashbacks/Reactivations
riskFactors.description: Brief re-experiences of drug effects after acute effects worn off
riskFactors.frequencyComparison: More frequent with 5-MeO-DMT than typical psychedelics

characteristics.valence: Most positive or neutral, some negative
characteristics.timing: May be more common at night or when falling asleep

mechanism.hypothesis: May relate to epileptiform activity in temporal lobes

riskFactors.requiredResearch: Long-term follow-up needed to determine true frequency, intensity, duration, and impairment

riskFactors.name: Sensitization Rather Than Tolerance
riskFactors.description: Repeated use may increase rather than decrease effects
riskFactors.mechanism: Opposite of tolerance - effects become stronger with repeated use
evidence: May explain higher peak experiences with individualized dosing regimens
implications: Higher doses after previous exposure may be dangerous
riskFactors.harmReduction: Caution with repeated use, don't assume tolerance

riskFactors.name: Potential for Seizure Activity
riskFactors.description: Unique pharmacology may increase seizure risk
mechanisms: White-outs may relate to seizure-like activity
5-HT1A receptor action in medial temporal lobes

riskFactors.name: Individual Metabolic Differences
implications: Some may experience unexpected effects from metabolites

riskFactors.name: Dangerous MAOI Interactions
riskFactors.description: Combining with MAOIs can be fatal
mechanism: Can lead to fatal serotonin syndrome

specificCombinations.outcome: Serotonin toxicity and death when combined with harmala alkaloids

riskFactors.note: Safety profile with MAOIs different from classical tryptamines

riskFactors.name: Source-Related Variability
riskFactors.description: Different experiences based on toad-derived vs synthetic source

toadDerived.uncertainEffects: Unclear if bufotenine in venom significantly impacts effects

riskFactors.userReports: Differences in reported experiences between toad and synthetic

includes: First or second-degree relatives with schizophrenia
Family history of bipolar disorder with psychosis

relative.rationale: Effects on cardiovascular system not well understood

relative.specificRisk: 87% experienced worsening anxiety in one study

relative.rationale: Unpredictable nature makes it less safe without controls
Lacks safety measures of clinical or ceremonial settings

relative.outcome: Increased risk of serotonin toxicity and other adverse events

psychological.name: Anxiety and Fear
psychological.timing: Particularly prior to and during onset (first 10-15 minutes)

psychological.name: Psychological Distress
psychological.note: While some experiences are cathartic, they can be psychologically distressing

psychological.name: Ego Dissolution
psychological.description: Strong sense of ego dissolution, detachment from body, altered self-perception

psychological.name: Overwhelming Mystical Experiences
psychological.valence: Often positive but can be challenging

behavioral.name: Lack of Awareness
behavioral.description: Users may lack awareness or memory of behaviors during acute effects

withdrawal.prevalence: No adverse events led to participant withdrawal

psychological.name: Flashbacks/Reactivations

characteristics.timing: May be more common at night/falling asleep

psychological.researchNeeded: Long-term follow-up to determine frequency, intensity, duration, impairment

psychological.name: Hallucinogen Persisting Perception Disorder (HPPD)
psychological.evidence: Not explicitly linked in same way as other psychedelics

type1.comparison: Reactivations may be similar to Type 1 HPPD

type2.documentation: No studies documenting HPPD specifically from 5-MeO-DMT

psychological.note: Theoretical risk based on other psychedelics

psychological.name: Sensitization with Repeated Use
psychological.description: Effects may become stronger rather than weaker with repeated use
evidence: Individualized dosing regimens show higher peak experiences
psychological.implication: Users may become more sensitive after repeated use

psychological.name: Memory Impairment
psychological.evidence: Transient impairment documented with psychedelics generally
psychological.specificTo5MeO: No specific indication of long-term memory impairment

psychological.name: Addiction Potential
psychological.note: While compulsive use risk is low, some may repeatedly use despite undesirable experiences

psychological.name: Persistent Negative Emotional States
psychological.clinicalSignificance: May lead to clinically significant problems

prevalence.context: Study of negative psychological responses to psychedelics

psychological.name: Need for Professional Assistance

ayahuasca.context: Ayahuasca users seeking mental health assistance

psychological.note: Specific data for 5-MeO-DMT not provided but likely similar

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Dosing Uncertainty
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Lack of standardization leads to uncertain dosing

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Purity Variability
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Inconsistent purity leads to unpredictable effects

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Toad-Derived Variability
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Venom from Incilius alvarius varies significantly

specificFactors.uncertainty: Unclear if bufotenine from venom significantly impacts effects vs. from 5-MeO-DMT metabolism

specificFactors.description: Multiple compounds in toad venom beyond 5-MeO-DMT and bufotenine

risks.description: Byproducts and impurities if synthesis not done properly

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Potency Inconsistencies Within Batches
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Even within single batch, potency can vary
qualityContaminationRisks.implication: Unintentionally consuming much higher dose than intended

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Substance Misidentification
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Substances sold as 5-MeO-DMT may not contain it

examples.knownIssues: Sold as LSD, responsible for emergency cases

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Manufacturing Byproducts
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Inadequate cleaning of production equipment in illicit labs

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Contamination with Serotonergic Agents
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Combination of 5-MeO-DMT with other serotonergic substances

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Research Chemical Misrepresentation
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Substances sold as 'research chemicals' may be misrepresented

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Long-term Health Risks from Contaminants
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Chronic exposure to contaminants or impure 5-MeO-DMT
qualityContaminationRisks.evidence: Not well understood due to lack of data

qualityContaminationRisks.name: Lack of Accurate Testing
qualityContaminationRisks.description: Limited access to accurate testing methods

harmReductionStrategies.rationale: Intense physical and psychological reactions require experienced support
qualifications: Knowledge of when to seek emergency help

methods: Avoiding dose escalation without proper spacing
harmReductionStrategies.rationale: Steep dose-response curve makes precision essential
Reduces risk of adulteration and unknown substances

harmReductionStrategies.timeframe: At least 2 weeks before and after 5-MeO-DMT use

considerations: Intranasal or IM may have lower reactivation risk than vaporized
IV route has highest intensity and risk
Never combine with MAOIs for oral route

components: Processing experience with therapist or guide

resources: Benzodiazepines available if in clinical setting

harmReductionStrategies.rationale: Sensitization may occur rather than tolerance
harmReductionStrategies.recommendation: Do not assume tolerance; may need lower doses with repeated use

nonPharmacological.description: Verbal reassurance that experience is temporary and they are safe

pharmacological.indication: Severe anxiety or agitation unresponsive to reassurance
pharmacological.note: Should be available in clinical settings

researchNeeds: Comparison of toad-derived vs synthetic preparations

keyLimitations: Small sample sizes in clinical research
Source variability (toad vs synthetic) confounds data
majorKnowledgeGaps: Comparison to classical psychedelics in therapeutic settings
